awd_titl_txt: Analysis and Modeling Tools for High-Speed Networks
awd_abstract_narration: This project, a collaborative effort between the San Diego                      Supercomputer Center (SDSC) and the University of California, San               Diego, (UCSD), addresses performance analysis on the Internet and               development of models to predict such performance.  There is a                  need for tools that analyze and model available network data and                also assist in defining data sets for network evaluation and                    optimization.  Such capabilities will become more critical as the               Internet and its NREN component develop higher performance and                  are are more high spread.                                                                                                                                       Some areas of initial investigation include assessments of                      network latencies, identification of traffic patterns and service               requirements, parameterization of network performance, and                      exploration of issues surrounding the granularity and scope of                  collected network data.***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
